channel.title: Hmm..i need some serious help
channel.description: OK, My friend and I are making a pivot website. Of course he will make the pivots. Now I'm wondering, how could i make a page that shows all the uploaded files on a .php document. i know how to make an uploader, but no idea how to list all the links of the downloads. Any pointers or example codes?

item.title: Hmm..i need some serious help
item.dc:creator: @fluffymuff1n fluffymuff1n
item.description:
@fluffymuff1n wrote:

Its an easy open source graphics program. It makes stick figures move. http://www.snapfiles.com/get/stickfigure.html http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&q=pivot&btnG=Google+Search

and thanks mastrchief.

Read full topic

item.title: Hmm..i need some serious help

item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

Sorry for sounding stupid, but what’s a pivot website?

Read full topic

item.title: Hmm..i need some serious help
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

<?php $Files = array("*.zip", "*.ZIP", "*.rar", "*.RAR", "*.exe", "*.EXE", "*.scar", "*.SCAR", "*.torrent", "*.TORRENT", "*.bat", "*.BAT", "*.txt", "*.TXT", "*.png", "*.PNG", "*.gif", "*.GIF", "*.jpg", "*.JPG", "*.jpeg", "*.JPEG"); echo "Files:<br />"; foreach (glob($Files) as $filename) { $Name = str_replace(" ", "%20", $filename); echo "<a href=\"$Name\">$filename</a>"." | Size: ".round((filesize($filename) / 1024), 1)." KB"."<br />"; } ?>

Heres how I’ve done it.

Read full topic
